text:
It's not about branding, it's about EDUCATION. Most Americans can't even identify socialist systems that exist in America right now. For example, our highway systems, Medicare/Medicaid and Social Security, military benefits, etc. These are socialist systems that exist that we all benefit from today. 

Most Americans have never read John Stuart Mill, Marx, Malcolm X, etc and have no real understanding of democracy, communism, etc.
It’s mind numbing the amount of coverage this election cycle from the right has branded Kamala a “communist/socialist/marxist” when she’s barely a liberal never mind a leftist lol.
Biden and Harris are centrist. Not FASCISTS like Trump.
they are fascists. they're technocratic fascists, unlike trump who is an opportunist fascist.
People hate Obamacare, but like the Affordable Care Act. People don’t care about your idealogical commitment to socialism, but what you can offer them at the end of the day.

Ite bro idek where I equated Biden/harris to Trump.

But also as the first reply to u states there’s a pretty solid argument to undermine ur statement here but I’m not up for e-drama on Reddit tn.
Trump is just more open about his fascism, the democrats aren’t as open about it.
Just like liberals with their bigotry.
Co-ops, credit unions, worker owned businesses.  Americans are surrounded by socialism and enjoy it and don't even realize it.

Please educate yourself on American history and foreign policy.  I would say anyone who materially supports fascists is a fascist.  Democrats and Republicans both happily support fascists, the Democrats are just less willing to be honest about that or their willingness to use it at home as well.
Ragan
Because capitalism is great for neurotypical people that are part of the in group. Cis WASPs.

Liberal idpol and socialist intersectionality are different things. We're not for "More! LGBT! Drone Pilots!". Also, you just kind of sound like a bigot. "All that bs" talking about marginalized groups.
What makes you think I’m a bigot?
Your flippant manner of referring to POC and ... what could be any number of marginalized people (queer, neurodivergent, religious minority). So long as they are unfree we all are unfree.
When did I say that Trump was better? Trump is worse so no one can criticize Kamala? That's a fucked up way of thinking.

We live in a two-party system. Your choices are Trump, Harris, or third party (Trump).

Criticize Harris all you want. I agree with a lot of the criticism, she is not perfect. But she is infinitely better than the lone alternative; Trump.

And yet, any time anyone criticizes Kamala (regardless of whether or not they say anything about voting) libs like yourself will go on and on and on about how Trump is so much worse and how a vote for people who aren't Trump is somehow a vote for Trump, despite the fact that the other side says exactly the reverse. The reality being that a vote for a third party doesn't help either party. The majority of third party voters would likely stay home rather than vote for parties they see as complicit in genocide. 

Let me be clear: you don't know how my vote is being used. Even if you think you know from reading my comment history? You don't know. And I'm not telling you. But you can rest assured that my vote will not be counted for Trump.

Also, you're not living in the same reality I am if you think the Democrats, who are currently overseeing the genocide, will change course under a leader who has said she'd change nothing about the Biden administration. (Psst, VPs running for president have broken with and criticized the sitting president they worked with in the past. She could do it if she wanted.)

We have a political process in the US that involves primaries and general elections. The time to criticize, withhold, and worry about perfectionism is the primaries. The time to hold your nose and swallow the least-worst option is the general election. 

We are passed the primaries. 

I never said the Democrats would change direction. They won't distance themselves from Israel and everyone knows it. But, they will listen and give a half-hearted push back while the alternative option will give a full throated endorsement to genocide.

>Candidates can and should be responsive to the voters they are courting.

Yes. The time to criticize is the primary election where you vote for the candidate that best aligns with your values. You tell the party what direction to go through the primary. That is why the Democratic party became far more progressive in the last decade, because Bernie Sanders commanded it through voting getting in the primaries.

The general election is the time to pick the least worst option. Not the time to have perfection be the enemy of good.
So once the primaries are over, whatever the candidate says goes? That's some MAGA logic. The candidate is not infallible. Grow up.

Of course not. But after the primaries the options and choices change. The option to oppose genocide is no longer on the table. Now the options are Absolutely Genocide or Feign Push-Back On Genocide. 

Choose one.

Hey. False dichotomy. There are other options (unless you think the only use for your vote is voting for the winner). Truly, liberals are exhausting. A third party vote is not a vote for Trump unless you believe that those votes are gettable, and if they're gettable and the Democrats are not voting for them? And more over if those votes are necessary for the candidate to win? Then responding to their criticism is a good idea and letting them criticize is a good way to find out what they want.

But by all means, democrats should absolutely continue ignoring the demands of the people who's votes they're asking for. That seems like a great way to convince those people that the Democrats are in fact movable and willing to work with them. Let's see how it works out for them.

I agree. It's bad strategy. The same strategy Clinton used and gave us Trump in the first place. But it gave us Trump in the first place. It will give us Trump again. And after Trump there is no guarantee that we ever get another opportunity to have a vote again. 

I agree Harris and the Democratic party is not ideal. But the other option is literally fascist take over of the United States government. The guy who said he wants to be a dictator and would purge any and all government employees and officials who are not loyalists, who has plans for mass deportations. 

The Democrats are holding a gun to our heads. And you would rather just get shot in the face than negotiate.
Comrades? COMRADES? LOLLLL 😂😂😂
Bruuuuuuuuhhh this is peak brainrot even for Reddit LMFAO
Oh those...yeah, I guess they have to be scapegoats for all things evil.

>Either you want leftist policies in government or you don't. Pick one.

Exactly. You vote for Democrats or you vote for Republicans. Pick one. You want leftist to have a voice and position in government, or, you don't.

Yeah, sure. But how is that a reason to not criticize Harris? She is not on the left, just nearer to it than Trump. So, because I want her to stop moving to the right, I'm going to criticize her. Maybe if a few more of her voters would do so, she'd actually hear us. Instead, you spend your time trying to silence us so that she can't.

It's not my job to get her elected. I'm not employed by her campaign. It's my job to try to get her to be the candidate that is worthy of my vote, regardless of how bad the other guy is. 

"Other guy bad" isn't an excuse to not call democrats out for aiding and abetting a genocide. I get that you're scared. So am I. But the ends do not justify the means (allowing thousands of Palestinians to be slaughtered by Israel without doing or saying anything).

But it doesn't sound like we're going to convince each other. We're just going around in circles at this point. Have a good weekend.
Fuck you genocide supporter

The Republican presidential candidate and several prominent Republican politicians and figureheads regularly call Democrats socialist. A couple of random fringe Democrats, who no one takes seriously or could identify by name, call Republicans socialists. 

These are not the same.

25% under commie/socialist? Your now worried about a budget surplus vs a huge deficit? X() ...you commies make me laugh. Just go and get a job and suck it up ...you have to become a functioning member of society and get off the government tit ...Austerity is hard but total economic destruction from socialist rot is worse. Your commie / socialst bosses dug a big deep hole for Argentina its gonna take time to climb out ....So A Trabajar Cabrones Flojos 🤣

You know, I was gonna give some thought out reply about how the quest for ideological purity can functionally aid fascists. 

But a quick peak at your comment history shows you’re likely just some uneducated kid who trolls half the communities you’re in. Maybe if you took part in some real activism you’d have something better to do with your time.

Fascism is when people don't want child sex change surgeries & procedures ..

How exactly are trans people oppressed & what does it have to do with economics ?

Thank you for the clear answer! Could I ask you one more thing?

What are there boundaries to people's freedoms or mechanisms to protect the rights of other people? Like, when I say that trans women shouldn't be allowed to go into the womans bathroom, because that is a safe space for cis women. How would a socialist analyze this conflict of ideas?
if Trump wins there will be boots on the ground and we'll never reach the future depicted in this video.
Math is hard
Don't think there is gonna be a Palestine memorial in Germany any time soon, and if Trump wins, their will be no memorials
If Kamala wins, it's no different. Or maybe worse. Any president is the puppet of ADL.
Did I say anything about Kamala Harris?

You don’t need to. I’m just giving you another probable result based on the situation you provided.

If Trump wins, then bla bla bla. If Kamala wins, then bla bla bla will still happen. Simple as that.
I was eating at a Lebanese dessert place in Dearborn michigan, talking with the owner how Palestinian refugees fucked up Lebanon and Jordan. The knafeh was on point.
There are more Palestinians born than killed. Worst genocide ever really 0/10.

I'm stuck on something. I couldn't create a separate post for this, but I'll post it here. I was reading [this article on World Socialist Web Site](https://www.wsws.org/en/articles/2024/10/24/pxyn-o24.html) (WSWS) when I came across this paragraph:

"*In the aftermath of the failed coup of January 6, 2021, the Biden-Harris administration sought deliberately to revive the Republican Party in order to provide a bipartisan basis for an aggressive foreign policy, directed initially against Russia—instigating the war in Ukraine—but since expanding to the Middle East (Gaza, Lebanon and soon Iran), and ultimately aimed against China.*"

I'm not sure what WSWS's stance on the Russia-Ukraine war is, but the words "instigating the war in Ukraine" feels out of place. Most evidence points to Russia instigating the war and not the U.S., but this article seems to ignore that. What's your take on this?
Slava Ukraine
Ukraine. They didn’t deserve to have another country come in and start killing them. I am heartbroken at the deaths in both sides though, human lives being used as cannon fodder.

Anti-Russian sentiment happened in specific regions within Ukraine. Western Ukraine was pro-EU, whereas Eastern and Southern Ukraine were pro-Eurasian Economic Alliance. When the Maidan Revolution happened in 2014 and the democratically elected , albeit pro-Russian , President was overthrown, many Ukrainian citizens living in the pro-Russian parts of Ukraine felt that the new interim government was a Western plant and they distrusted the direction that Ukraine was heading in. If you look at the polling data, the folks living in Crimea and the Donbas oblasts *overwhelmingly* voted for Victor Yanukovych, whereas folks living in Western Ukraine were pretty split on their opinion of Yanukovych. 

The main reason that the West is blamed for the current state of affairs between Ukraine and Russia is that the West, particularly the United States, gave funding and arms training to the right-wing militias that eventually overthrew the Yanukovych government. They fanned the flames of the already growing dissent against pro-Russian sentiment in Ukraine. And for this reason, a majority of Ukrainians actually believe that the United States is the largest party to blame for the conflict in the Donbas, at least according to polling data from 2022.

If China incorporated Mexico in a strategic defensive alliance, how do you think America would respond? Who would you blame (most) if a war broke out? Mexico, America, or China? 

Describing pro-western representation as a sphere of influence belies what a sphere of influence specifically is; strategic economic and military exclusivity weaponized for the benefit of an imperial power. Economic inclusion didn't have to be this way, but America for whatever reason decided after the USSR dissolved that it'd just continue operating as if it's the cold war and gobbled up every former soviet satellite state.
I also agree with this sentiment, even if it may go against popular opinions.
So, Ukraine.
Do you favour israel/palestine both neither?
Exactly this. We did the same thing to Cuba with just notably worse results. I don’t see how this is much different.
Conflict of a very different nature

Euromaidan was a CIA backed coup. They then proceeded to make life hell for anti-coup citizens, both Ukrainian and Russian speaking, but especially Russian speaking ones. Combined with them attempting to join NATO, and you can understand Russia’s position. They tried to make peace multiple times post Crimea annexation, and Ukraine rejected all of those attempts. Russia realized eventually that this was their only option. And if you bring up Finland in NATO as a counterpoint, they’re simply a different story.

They shouldn’t have been killing some of their own citizens and trying to join NATO which Russia would have never accepted.
Russia tried multiple peace agreements, Ukraine chose blood, under the delusion that the West was gonna save them directly with a no-fly zone and whatnot. Euromaidan was not the will of the majority, only some regions, many others were against it. Coup. They could have stayed neutral, but now they’ll probably be fully within Russia’s sphere.
I don’t like the current Russian government very much, but they had few options. Ultimately, the West wanted this war, even if it’s not going perfectly as planned.
Tell that to Ukraine, who slaughtered some of their own people long before Russia directly intervened. This war didn’t start in 2022, it had been a civil war for a while.

Ukraine: Even though I understand the opposition to NATO, the fact remains that Russia is invading another country and I want people living in Ukraine to be able to choose for themselves.

Not to mention that Putin's government is nowhere near socialist, so why on earth would I have any more support for them than I would have for Zelensky's or the US?
Yes, it's still a capitalist economy.
Ukraine,Russia is a imperialist nation

I’m firmly in the Ukrainian camp. I want them to win so badly, and to beat Putin and his authoritarian self into submission. Especially now that North Korea is mobilizing troops to help Russia, and Ukraine was asking for tomahawk missiles. I hope zelynsky blows Putin sky high, and that the innocent people on both sides can return to normalcy in a safe country with its own right to self-determination. Putin not wanting Ukraine in NATO is spoiled baby behavior

Socialism does have a very strict definition which is that it's a transitional stage between capitalism and communism where the dictatorship of the proletariat has been established, but existing economic relations haven't been abolished. This is precisely what we see happening in China.

China is in fact a democratic worker state as anybody who is minimally educated regarding China would know. Beyond that China does not actually experience boom and bust cycles of capitalism, and its economy has been growing steadily for decades on end.

Maybe spend a bit of time actually educating yourself on a subject you're attempting to debate.
Ukraine. We should always stand with oppressed peoples against their oppressors, though I’m obviously biased, being Ukrainian-Canadian myself
https://redsails.org/china-has-billionaires/

In the long run this was a very successful strategy.  China's industry and infrastructure grew to be much larger than the States and up until recently the US mostly thought China was capitalist as there were external trappings and many profits to be made, so China was not a country they tried to sabotage development in for the most part, unlike the USSR.  The US has found that they cannot co-opt China through covert means and now China can regionally match anything the US can do militarily.  

So we'll see if slow changes occur  towards a "purer" socialism.  I think there's no rush - they have control of the country's finances (unless the governments in the west) and so long as wealth inequality is managed and even decreases, it's heading in a stable direction.  I actually think Putin is looking and learning as he wants to do more about his oligarchs gradually.  Socialist thought is not dead in Russia, it was just put in hibernation by extreme inequality.

>so long as wealth inequality is managed and even decreases, it's heading in a stable direction

income, yea; wealth, not necessarily, if it creates more business owners

i'm not worried about chinese billionaires, i'm worried about the 40 million or so small to medium enterprises, whose owners are just as reactionary but much more numerous

Traditionally only billionaires really become an imbalance to the system from undue political influence.  Millionaires aren't a worry to me.  Unlike in the US, China has a huge freedom to play with bank policies, tax rates, estate taxes on death, etc.  It's the long term that matters.  In US the myth is a rising tide lifts all boats, but it seems to be real in China; the main concern is to head off any potential oligarchy.

>It's the long term that matters.

but that's what i'm worried about. sure, china doesn't have to directly expropriate SMEs, they can make most of those businesses disappear with policies and maybe even unfair competition from SOEs. but that still feeds anti-communist sentiment, and when that sentiment infects 40 million people and their immediate families it can get *really* dangerous

i seriously don't care about billionaires, they're notorious and few, so they're very easy for the government to control. SMEs are an entirely different matter, in fact they're usually the ones mostly responsible for the bad side of chinese influence in other countries, precisely because they fly under the cpc's radar

don't get me wrong, i know why they exist and their role, and i understand the reforms - i actually blame the fall of the USSR mostly on the premature (though politically necessary) end of the NEP, so i obviously don't want china going the same road. my point is just that if the reduction of wealth inequality comes from each billionaire becoming a thousand millionaires, that is just worse situation

So what do you think china is heading towards im very curious..do you think ccp will eventually take the shape of ussr and everything will become workers owned eventually? , can it grow the economy without capitalist framework?.Everywhere they are saying companies are leaving china but nowhere they are saying where they are investing will it stagnate their gdp growth?

I think that's precisely what's going to happen, and in fact we can see that happening already. The role of private sector in China continues to shrink.

https://www.piie.com/research/piie-charts/2024/chinas-private-sector-has-lost-ground-state-sector-has-gained-share-among

I'm also not sure why you think that companies leaving China will have much of an impact on the economy overall. It's not like they can pack up their factories and take them. All it's going to mean is that more economy will become nationalized over time.

Please Vote Against Trump --> He's a Literal Fascist

I'm just talking about swing states: Arizona, Nevada, Wisconsin, Michigan, Pennsylvania, North Carolina & Georgia 

Trump is a fascist. Despite his claims to the contrary his administration / team has deep ties to Project 2025, a plan with incredibly disturbing implications for the future of the u.s. Personally I also hate Kopmala Harris and the fact that she & the Biden administration are enablers of the ongoing Israeli genocide of Palestinians. But even so Trump is categorically worse on this and a myriad of other issues.

In fact Gazan refugees think that Trump is the worst possible choice:

https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/23/trump-would-be-the-worst-palestinians-react-to-us-presidential-race

And here's a comic that breaks down what Trump's Project 2025 is all about: 

https://stopproject2025comic.org/

And here's an article about how closely tied Trump & his backers are to Project 2025:

https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/10/22/us/politics/project-2025-trump-heritage-foundation.html

China doesn't define itself as captialist or socialist in the classical sense. Well, that's why it is "socialism with Chinese characteristics". What it means is that China will follow its own path to benefit the country and its population the way it sees fit in its developmental stages. 

So, to your questions, yes and no, or, yes, but not in the way that you think. It is growing the economy using both capitalist and non-capitalist methods. It is also controling the commanding heights. It will not take the shape of USSR, because that just wouldn't be China. The whole country is in a big transitional phase and it might never stop because CCP is always adjusting its strategies and ideas.

Which wouldn't mean much by itself, but they're also electrifying their economy at a rapid pace, so that renewable electric(!) energy is actually displacing fossil instead of just growing along with it as it is for the rest of us losers.

>“…if everyone started emitting as much carbon as the private jets and superyachts of the average billionaire in Oxfam’s study, [the carbon budget] would be gone in two days.”  
Jesus

We shouldn’t have to live in a world where people are forced to donate money in order to save each other’s lives from fighting governments. So many innocent Palestinians have died because Hamas and the IDF are both hell bent on destroying each other. This war is fueled by racism and hate on both sides, and average people are paying the price. I don’t see how someone, knowing what we know now, could support either country’s actions. Hamas was not justified in invading Israel and killing innocent civilians, but Israel was also not justified in doing the same thing back on a much larger scale. This whole war is messed up and no matter who wins, there won’t be much of Gaza left to own. You obviously know that already and I know me saying this won’t change anything but it’s just so dystopian.

Ok but you are agreeing with me and not with the OP who said racism only goes in one direction. You are just rationalizing the racism in the Arab and Moslem world saying that it is understandable. By the same token you can say it is understandable that many young Israelis are racist as they have grown up in a world where their Arab neighbors have been attempting to and successfully killing and their families them their whole lives. If we're being honest we should be able to agree that both sides hate each other for understandable reasons, but there is definitely racism on both sides.
Serial killers deserve the death penalty
Well, it's anti stalinsim. Anyway I think it's okay
Wasn't he a part of the Democratic socialist thing? Anyway, I think he was mainly anti-stalinist. Anyway, could ya give me some links about that? If you don't mind, of course.

George "I hate the communist party in Spain and I was really bored dicking around in Aragon for several months" Orwell isn't gonna fuck you. He's dead. You can read the anti-communist propaganda for children he wrote if you want

I'm not American but I'd support neither democrats nor republicans and vote third party usually but in this election I'd vote Kamala as a lesser of two evils because I genuinely believe democracy is at stake.

A single vote does not equate to "support."  I think if you're in a swing state, voting for the lesser of two evils has more to do with strategy than principle.  Besides, compromise is built into life, esp these days... who among us?
It's counter revolutionary
So, bad socialist bad?
Which capitalist is the lesser of two evils shouldn't concern us as socialists.
The only true answer

I understand the sentiment. But one of these two will be elected and have an effect on our daily lives, should we not choose the one that is not openly saying they want to send the military after their enemies?

I don't know you or anyone else online to make any claims of what kind of socialist they are, but if you have a strong ideology and call yourself anti-imperialist and anti-capitalist then how do you justify voting backing any agent of empire? The idea of "lesser of two evils" is a fallacy. Lesser to who? Not the global south, not Gaza, or Sudan, or the Congo, or Cuba, or.......
One is openly saying it and the other is already doing it. Remember the student protests against Israel? So let's not entertain either as harm reduction.
Those universities made those decisions themselves. Not at the behest of the administration

Can you define "support"?   merely casting strategic votes to keep fascists out of power is not support".  "Support" would be canvassing, putting out yard signs, and (god forbid) donating money to candidaates in the two big parties.
Well-stated.

I think it’s designed in a way to make proper feel like their doing change, it’s masking an illusion of choice when really there is no return or at the very least when moderate reform is mandatory to maintain order among the masse, also the dems are a handy graveyard for political movements such as the occupy Wall Street being funneled into  the controlled opposition party,

In short the GOP push the capitalist agenda where as the Dems are their to undermine pushback, like some actually think their doing something special by voting for democrats

So we should just let our situation get worse in solidarity? How much more difficult would building a socialist movement in this country become with the guy quoting Hitler and saying he wants to be a dictator for one day and having a real life purge …
I feel like the 2016 win for Trump had a negative effect on progress for socialism. Another win for Trump will just push more people to the right and blame socialists for the loss.

I think "strategic" voting rather than voting for what you actually want will only lead to the overton window being shifted progressively further from what you actually want because the chief driver behind policy are capital interests.

What we should do is continue to organize and step up our agitation here in the imperial core. The idea that it's so much worse under one guy than the other only allows things to continue so long as we have some small level of comfort in the U.S. At some point, the pressure getting extreme is the only thing that will push some to action. Under current Dem leadership we have multiple U.S. sided genocides across the globe, cop cities being built in numerous states, a fascist Supreme Court, income inequality at an all time high, massive houselessness, obscene health care costs, skyrocketing goods and services costs, I mean let's be real.

And you can’t put the effort in for that AND cast a ballot? What about all the immigrants and refugees building better lives here who will be directly impacted, whose families will be directed impacted by the largest deportation policy in us history?

I ask why you're under the impression that immigration policy was good under any Dem administration. Obama deported around 1 million more immigrants than Bush did. Liberation struggle is protracted, you can't expect things to magically change today. Our fight is for future generations.
Not necessarily. We can quietly vote for the lesser evil candidate while publicly denouncing their capitalist policies, pushing for socialism, and involving ourselves in socialist organization.

Nah. You have a chance to vote out a child molester and devoted fascist. If you consider yourself a moralist and haven't considered how that at least is a genuinely good thing to do you probably care more about the idea of being a socialist than genuine action or change. Defeat the fascist and continue agitating. Voting is one tool of many. It's not that freaking hard.

What is counter-revolutionary is allowing a far-right reactionary fascist to take power and send the socialist cause back by decades instead of making the unsavoury sacrifice of casting a reluctant vote for the lesser evil candidate.


And I say this as a Canadian who won't even have to live under a Trump regime if he's elected.
Socialists should support socialist movements.

None of them have proposed what he’s proposing…, you can fight for future generations while still making sure what freedom to organize we have left remains cause once it’s no longer there , fighting for the future will be increasingly difficult

i think theres more value in voting for the candidate you want as a rallying point to organize around even if they have no chance of winning. When people have a concrete number they can put on the fact they aren't alone in feeling like the lesser evil is dogshit they're also more likely to outwardly advocate for their actual views in the real world.
Thank you

At what point does evil become intolerable from an absolute standpoint, regardless of other potential evils on the table? That is the point at which you cut all ties to the bourgeois Democratic Party. For many, that line was crossed when the dems showed themselves to be uncritical and enthusiastic supporters of the travesty occurring in Gaza. For others, the line has yet to be crossed, as they fear that the other party is simply too malevolent to be given any chance at taking power.

In all honesty, the far left is such a tiny proportion of the US population that our opinions and votes are irrelevant from a strategic perspective. Vote how you will according to whether you believe that the line has been crossed, and know that the only thing judging you is the slow progression of history.
If this is really your take, you need to study more because your politic is severely underdeveloped.
Some states are decided by couple thousand votes, they make a difference

If voting constitutes more than .001% of your political activity then how you’re doing it isn’t the problem. 

Ultimately, how you vote, if at all, *should* be pretty immaterial to any socialist discussion.

Here's the thing, I think it's arguably defensible as a strategic thing.

If I were in a swing state, I'd probably consider it myself. Premise: it's basically a statistical certainty that come election day we will have elected either the jerk or the cop, and looking at them it's not unreasonable to argue that electing him is some amount worse, so there's some value to doing what you can to have the less shitty one win. Is it truly worth it to you, is an answer we all have to have with ourselves.

I'm voting third party for sure but that's because my state will forevermore blue so my vote, as it pertains to the election results, is irrrelevant and I can use it to add to the collective chorus of, "Hey maybe don't?"

Tell that to Haiti and any other number of revolutionary struggles that were born of extreme oppression and conditions we can only imagine. It's an insult to previous generations to say if we don't betray our principles, we can't fight back. If you think a president dictates the freedom we have to organize, then you're not studying enough. Organizing happens IN SPITE of who's in charge. We will be killed, repressed, and labeled as terrorists by both parties.

Again you’re essentially saying we should let our lives get worse simply in solidarity with people who struggled way more. What about all the people that die organizing in tougher conditions? Is that really what you would rather let it get to

Those are not states where leftism is a popular ideology. Leftists in the United States are concentrated in urban enclaves and the coastal states, which have been so thoroughly annexed by the Democratic Party that they only risk losing them through their sheer incompetence and inability to field popular candidates. Your vote for them will be simply yet another blue vote in a blue county. There are very few counties which actually decide elections, and it is those counties upon which candidates push their issues. It’s why Harris and Trump were bending over backwards to try and please Pennsylvania oil frackers. 

Let’s not delude ourselves. Core electorates for both parties are so captured by the state apparatus that their “choice” barely even matters.

Would “let trump win so conditions will get worse, forcing more people to become radicalized, therefore accelerating revolution” be a more or less developed take? Theres some really dark parts of my mind buried way deep in the back that actually thinks that way

Dude, the point is our lives are getting worse regardless of who's in the big chair. You are deluding yourself to think otherwise. Policies of both parties cause death and destabilization across  the globe. How if you're a person of conscience, do you participate in a system that facilitates that? Are the Democrats planning on stopping military aid to Israel? So what about those people who will die as a result of that? If we're serious about stopping these conditions, voting for either candidate gets us no closer to that goal. All we should be concerned with is creating systems of autonomy that give people alternatives to the state, engaging in class struggle to highlight contradictions under capitalism, and organizing direct actions and mass movements in the U.S.

Spot on. The amount of people in this thread bargaining with themselves is very sad. Vote your conscious. The only thing you control in this situation is your vote. Don't be bullied into making a evil choice, regardless of its degree.

Multiple things can be true at the same time. Yes things are getting worse no matters whose in charge, yes we have the bare minimum of democratic participation, yes one candidate will make things slightly worse than the other and yes there’s no logical point in making things more difficult for the movement simply for the sake of claiming youre doing it out of some misplaced sense of solidarity. I promise you struggling people around the world don’t give a shit if you’re choosing to not cast a ballot

I'd say it's moreso understanding that's what it might take as opposed to letting him win. I wouldn't vote regardless of who the nominees are. > the person i was discussing with kept insisting that the only reason nato exists is to "stop russian imperialism" 

This is mostly true. NATO was formed to counter the Soviet Union, and its primary role today is a defensive alliance against Russian expansionism. 

Its purpose became less clear after the collapse of the Soviet Union, but became increasingly relevant after Russia invaded Georgia in 2008, annexed Crimea in 2014, and finally launched a full scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

> and that theyve only really acted defensively and never offensively. 

This is sort of true. They have never acted offensively with the goal of expanding some kind of NATO empire. However, they've conducted some operations that are hard to call 100% defensive – more like exp

- They intervened in the Bosnian War, escalating gradually from sanctions and enforcing a no-fly zone to conducting air strikes and deploying peacekeeping troops, alongside troops from non-NATO countries, after the war ended. It is not clear that the Bosnian War had posed a direct threat to NATO countries. However, their actions were authorized by the U.N., and the air strikes were in response to the Bosnian Serb Army's massacre of Muslim civilians, the first officially recognized genocide since WWII.

- NATO also intervened forcefully to end the Kosovo war, nominally because of the humanitarian crisis and ongoing war crimes. Although the U.N. had condemned Yugoslavia's actions and called for ceasefires, the Security Council did not approve military action, due to opposition from Russia and China. This was the first time NATO used military force without the endorsement of the U.N.

- Article 5 (An attack on one country is an attack on all) was invoked for the first time by the United States, after the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks. They cooperated on various operations like patrolling the US airspace and securing shipping routes.  After the US invaded Afghanistan, the U.N. established the International Security Assistance Force (ISAF) to stabilize the capital region and help build a permanent Afghan government. NATO eventually took command of ISAF's mission at the request of both the U.N. and the Afghan government. This was the first time NATO had a mission outside of the North Atlantic region. The U.N. later expanded their mission to provide security for the entire county. Overall, Afghanistan was kind of an L.

- NATO trained Iraqi security forces during the Iraq war, at their and the UN's request, without actively participating in combat.

- In 2009 NATO conducted anti-piracy missions in the gulf and Indian ocean area, in cooperation with Russia and China.

- In 2011 NATO intervened in Libya, almost entirely via air power, to enforce the U.N.'s mandated no-fly zone. 7 months later, Libya's ruler Gaddafi was killed by rebels, at which point the UN ended NATO's mandate for military enforcement and they pulled out shortly after that. Libyans generally supported the intervention as Gaddafi was deeply unpopular, but like Afghanistan, the state disintegrated very quickly. Its hard to call this one a success.

If you want to read more about these conflicts and others I didn't mention: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_NATO_operations

In my personal opinion, NATO is critical for the security of western and central Europe. They do provide a very strong deterrent against Russian aggression. I also believe they should stay in their lane (defending Europe, North America, and *maybe* international shipping routes).
